content.text:
# Draft:Erin Meagan Schwartz

Erin Meagan Schwartz is a Jewish interdisciplinary creative based in Winnipeg, Manitoba..
Schwartz graduated from the University of Winnipeg and was the recipient of the Mayor's Medal . She was involved in activism at this time including work with the Institute for Women's and Gender Studies and other events such as Take Back The Night. She was notably involved in the We Care Campaign's collaborative We Care Quilt in honour of Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women along with Leah Gazan, Christina Hajjar, Roewan Crowe, Marieke Gruwel, and quilter Tracy Popp.
Schwartz has been involved in various theatrical productions  in Winnipeg. She has performed in shows including zahgidiwin/love by Frances Koncan, inertia at the Winnipeg Fringe Festival, a reimagined ensemble production of My Name Is Rachel Corrie with One Trunk Theatre , and improv shows with The Neighbourhood Watch Improv.
She has worked on the production side for shows including The Winnipeg School of Happiness by Brigette DePape at the Winnipeg Fringe Festival, Heavenly Bodies by Gislina Patterson with happy/accidents , and the University of Winnipeg's Improv Festival.
She has published and written for Jewish Canadian zine SIMCHA.  She wrote Grace of the Projected Grotesque with Brigitta Weiss for the Village Conservatory for Music Theatre's festival of new works
Schwartz works at the Winnipeg Public Library .
